website_summaries.verdict: A top gaming motherboard by a trusted brand that is designed to deliver for avid gamers. It comes at a reasonable price point, too.
pros: This responsive gaming motherboard delivers the action, as it is compatible with Intel 8th and 9th Gen processors
Has a reliable fan that isn't overly noisy when running
cons: Board has six screw holes compared to the eight or nine found in most cases

customer_reviews.title: Great "Budget" Z390 Board
customer_reviews.text: Had everything I needed and it all works. I love the M.2 CNVi compatible wireless card slot. I bought an Intel AC-9560 wireless card (requires CNVi) and it works extremely well in this board. Be aware that older BIOS (0605/0805) will not display any video if trying to boot with a Samsung 970 EVOPlus NVMe SSD. I had to remove it to be able to see BIOS/UEFI on boot. After updating to BIOS 1002 the card was recognized and I had video. Also note that this board only has four (4) SATA III ports. It was all I needed but has caught others by surprise.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuy

customer_reviews.title: Low-end Asus board. Still does the job.
customer_reviews.text: This board was used in a build with an i5 9600K and 3000MHz DDR4. The RAM slots are very tight. Only one clip on each memory slot flips out to allow proper seating and removal of RAM. Also, there is no screw to seat into the case offset on the upper corner of the board nearest the RAM slots. This can make inserting RAM difficult as the board will bend and damage if you aren't careful.
customer_reviews.author: R. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard for price.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy using this motherboard it is very good! There is only one this that is worry sum and that since this is an atx mother board it only has six instead of the usual 8 screws holes that others come with. Also, it has an rgb strip built into the board that from my knowledge is unprogramable and is set to an orange color, good for an orange build. One last thing is when I was building I had trouble getting the motherboard to fit inside of the NZXT H500i case, I eventually managed to get it in just took a lot of work.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Dahlby

customer_reviews.title: Nice board but be ready to do some reading about the settings.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it works really well but it is a little harder to get the settings right when you're setting it up. The manual helps but it isn't as clear as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Compton

customer_reviews.title: Dumpster Fire
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product two months ago and the CMOS battery has already died. Contacting support requires a serial number, which requires the product to be turned off and dis assembled in the middle of the work day. I completely regret purchasing this motherboard... because the time on the computer is wrong, and I need to know the time very specifically to do my job... constantly wondering is the time correct. Brand new out of the box. Battery dead. No Support without taking the system completely offline during the workday to find a serial number.
customer_reviews.author: Wobert

customer_reviews.title: Solid Unit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Worked perfectly right from the start. Would have liked an additional USB 2.0 header, though.
customer_reviews.author: Todd D.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it's supposed to do. Leaves plenty of room for equipment. Even with a large tower cooler as you can see in the picture, the ram is still able to use dual channel slot config. Great board, works well with i9 processor. The BIOS is very easy to navigate.
customer_reviews.author: Combs

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This product does NOT support recently released RAM and has a weak BIOS. Bought it and tried for a week to see what RAM I can buy that would be supported only to realize that the motherboard is just weak. This is a budget motherboard for entry level PC builders BUT has the price tag of a mid level motherboard. Returned it then I got the Prime z390-A which worked immediately with my 32 GB of RAM and made it easier to overclock in BIOS with AI OC for only $40 dollars more. If you got this or if you are planning to get this; get the z390-A instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Stable Overclocking, Great Features!
customer_reviews.text: Handles my i9 just fine at 5ghz, nice and spacious design, components don't get too hot. All the latest bells and whistles including USB 3.1 headers.
customer_reviews.author: A-Z Reviews

customer_reviews.title: burnt by a riser cable
customer_reviews.text: burnt by a riser cable, can't say whether the riser or the motherboard is to be blamed; overall looks like a garbage product though
customer_reviews.author: mutoid

customer_reviews.title: Awesome looking refurb! Bought by mistake though.
customer_reviews.text: Even though I returned this because I meant to buy a non refurbished product, I did inspect the board, if youre not needing an i/o shield, screws, or mounting brackets, then this is a fair purchase. Being that this is my first time building my own pc, I needed these things. But what I paid for, without reading everything like I should have, I got what I paid for and would have been happy with it if I was more inclined.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: set up was a bit different due to the way bios hides the function to load windows by USB but only took an hour to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to build my own computer. I am very glad that I did. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Florence Rink

customer_reviews.title: I bought this Amazon Renewed, works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Works straight out of the box, recognized my RAM timing and clockspeed, as well as the CPU.
customer_reviews.author: hello goose

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a non gaming pc. Very easy install and has adequate slots. Im happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: zengoose10

customer_reviews.title: I love it, BUT
customer_reviews.text: This board is amazing however if you go with an AIO make sure you get an internal usb hub as there is only one usb connector. With a corsair case and Corsair AIO you will have to use the slot for the AIO pump so you wont be able to control the fan colors of the case fans in iCue, as far as functionality, this mobo is amazing
customer_reviews.author: Blake Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Has worked out great for me
customer_reviews.text: Has been good to me over the past 3 months. It had been about 8 years since I built my last machine and and I just needed something for my home office and maybe a little more. Setup was easy and have not run into any problems. Rock solid at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Decent Mobo for price
customer_reviews.text: This is decent if you're on a budget. Only has 1 USB header so if you're planning on putting lots of RGB, you're going to need to buy a splitter or find a Mobo that supports more than just 1 USB header.
customer_reviews.author: Jon & Daenary's

customer_reviews.title: Exactly described description.
customer_reviews.text: Got this z390 within 3 days, up and running 20 mins out of the box, Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value for a 1151 chipset board
customer_reviews.text: This board will save you money and perform better/same than other boards that cost twice as much. I will always use ASUS when it comes to computers.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and looks really good.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this motherboard for about a month now and it has not given me a single problem
customer_reviews.author: Chris Barron Romero

customer_reviews.title: Great buy all of them
customer_reviews.text: Yeeted this thing in and blew up like 5 of my processors so it’s a really good one if you want a time limit to play
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt Laird

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good for cheep motherboard and a lot of futures with it :D
customer_reviews.author: Hussain mukhtar

customer_reviews.title: Solid motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Solid motherboard without wifi module. Recommend for any standard build. $500 - $1500 pc build. Does not heat up or crash when operating at 90% capacity for hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: One Led is hid by my vid card
customer_reviews.text: I had no issue setting this up with Win 10, a GTX 2070XC, and a 9th gen I7 9700k, and gave it an AOI Corsair h115i. I clocked this single core to 4.7Ghz. I put 1 TB of M.2s on board, and added a 4 TB Caviar black WD drive for fun I lit it up. This does pretty much anything I need it to. I have never looked back.
customer_reviews.author: Baznoc(tm)

product_meta.title: Asus Prime Z390-P LGA1151 (Intel 8th and 9th Gen) DDR4 DP HDMI M.2 Z390 ATX Motherboard with USB 3.1 Gen2
product_meta.description: Designed for 9th generation Intel Core processors, the Prime Z370-P delivers fully customizable performance. 5x Protection III with FanXpert 4 provides hardware-level safeguards, while safe Slot Core fortified PCIe slots prevent damage caused by heavyweight GPUs. Asus optimum II ensures better DRAM overclocking stability by minimizing trace interference.
feature_bullets: Designed for 9th and 8th Generation Intel Core processors to maximize connectivity and speed with M.2, USB 3.1 Gen2 and Asus optimum II for better DRAM overclocking stability
5x Protection III Hardware-level safeguards with safe Slot Core, LANGuard and overvoltage protection provide component longevity and reliability
Fanxpert 4 with AIO pump header delivers advanced fan control for dynamic system cooling
Patent-pending Safe Slot Core fortified PCIe Slots prevent damage caused by heavyweight GPUs
8-Channel HD gaming audio featuring Realtek ALC887 high definition Audio CODEC

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars162 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
